quotes.quote: If you want to have clean ideas, change them as often as your shirt.
You start out giving your hat, then you give your coat, then your shirt, then your skin and finally your soul.
Beware of the naked man who offers you his shirt.
The loss of wealth is loss of dirt, as sages in all times assert; The happy man's without a shirt.
Wearing the same shirts doesn't make a team.
Mediocrity's like a spot on a shirt—it never comes off.
Anyone who has two shirts when someone has none is not a christian.
I find that a shirt is most similar to a napkin when I don't have a napkin.
We need to be just before we are generous, as we need shirts before ruffles.
Put yourself in their shoes before you decide on the best way to take their shirts.
Surrealism is the magical surprise of finding a lion in a wardrobe, where you were 'sure' of finding shirts.
Fortunes made in no time are like shirts made in no time; it's ten to one if they hang long together.
There are other measures of self-respect for a man, than the number of clean shirts he puts on every day.
The person who is waiting for something to turn up might start with their shirt sleeves.
Pride is the shirt of the soul, put on first and put off last.
To treat a poor wretch with a bottle of Burgundy, and fill his snuffbox, is like giving a pair of laced ruffles to a man that has never a shirt on his back.
A habit is a shirt made of iron.
A shirt's not just a shirt. It's the experience of what goes into that shirt.
If you have two shirts in your closet, one belongs to you and the other to the man with no shirt.
The laundry has its hands on my dirty shirts, sheets, towels and tablecloths, and who knows what tales they tell.
The man who rolls up his sleeves seldom loses his shirt.
If everyone gives one thread, the poor person will have a shirt.
